Opened issue "Broken symlinks return HTTP 500 instead of HTTP 404" (#2775) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Repro:
```
dotnet new mvc
ln -s doesnotexists.txt wwwroot/test.txt
dotnet run
```
http://localhost:5000/test.txt

**Expected**
HTTP 404. This file does not exist

**Actual**
HTTP 500
```
FileNotFoundException: Could not find file '/private/tmp/symlink/wwwroot/test.txt'.
Interop.ThrowExceptionForIoErrno(ErrorInfo errorInfo, string path, bool isDirectory, Func<ErrorInfo, ErrorInfo> errorRewriter)
Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeFileHandle.Open(string path, OpenFlags flags, int mode)
System.IO.FileStream..ctor(string path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, int bufferSize, FileOptions options)
Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.Physical.PhysicalFileInfo.CreateReadStream()
```

**details**
macOS
```
<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.All" Version="2.1.0-preview1-28042" />
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Could not load file or assembly 'System.Text.Encoding.CodePages, Version=4.1.0.0...'" (#2753) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @pingvinius on January 7, 2018 18:43_

Hello,

I found a strange issue when using CodePagesEncodingProvider of System.Text.Encoding.CodePages assembly.
I did not test other encoding but when I try to return a file in aspnet core mvc application in the following encoding CodePagesEncodingProvider.Instance.GetEncoding(866), the application throws an exception:

> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Text.Encoding.CodePages, Version=4.1.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. The system cannot find the file specified.
> 
> File name: 'System.Text.Encoding.CodePages, Version=4.1.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'
>    at aspnet_codepage_test.Controllers.HomeController.GetFile()
>    at lambda_method(Closure , Object , Object[] )
>    at Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.ObjectMethodExecutor.Execute(Object target, Object[] parameters)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeActionMethodAsync>d__12.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeNextActionFilterAsync>d__10.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Rethrow(ActionExecutedContext context)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Next(State& next, Scope& scope, Object& state, Boolean& isCompleted)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeInnerFilterAsync>d__14.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker.<InvokeNextResourceFilter>d__22.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker.Rethrow(ResourceExecutedContext context)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker.Next(State& next, Scope& scope, Object& state, Boolean& isCompleted)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker.<InvokeFilterPipelineAsync>d__17.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker.<InvokeAsync>d__15.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.RouterMiddleware.<Invoke>d__4.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.ExceptionHandlerMiddleware.<Invoke>d__6.MoveNext()
> 

A code is extremely simple:
```
public IActionResult GetFile()
{
       var encoding = CodePagesEncodingProvider.Instance.GetEncoding(866);
       var bytes = encoding.GetBytes("CÑ‚Ñ€Ð¾ÐºÐ°");

       return File(new MemoryStream(bytes), "text/plain", "111.txt");
}
```
As a initial string I use Russian word.

The interesting fact is it reproduces only in a production settings, so when I try to run it from a working directory, it works perfectly. Once I publish and run "dotnet ./project.dll", it fails.

I created a sample application to give it to you, so you can reproduce an issue. I also tried to run this application in a docker container, it has the same result.
[aspnet-codepage-test.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/files/1610082/aspnet-codepage-test.zip)

I have the following environment:
ubuntu 16.04
dotnet version: 2.0.0

Please find the steps to reproduce below:
- unzip an archive
- go to an extracted folder
- run: dotnet restore
- run: dotnet build -c Release
- run: dotnet publish -c Release
- run: dotnet ./bin/Release/netcoreapp2.0/publish/aspnet-codepage-test.dll 
- go to a browser and open http://localhost:5000/
- find a menu item "Get file" at the top of the page and click it

Please let me know if I missed something.
Thanks in advance.


_Copied from original issue: dotnet/corefx#26211_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Mvc.UseStaticFiles() will not serve files that are symbolic links; yielding empty files instead." (#2774) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Mvc.UseStaticFiles() will not serve files that are symbolic links; yielding empty files instead.

Reason: (new FileInfo(path)).Length does the wrong thing for what we are trying to do.

https://github.com/aspnet/FileSystem/blob/dev/src/FS.Physical/PhysicalFileInfo.cs:

    public long Length => _info.Length;

Nope. That's not going to work.

Due to lack of an appropriate API, the only way to get the length is to open the file, seek to the end, and read the position.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "unable to control web.config processPath and dotnet is not working " (#2773) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Looking for advice on a web.config/IIS deploy issue/bug.

I am deploying an  ASP.NET core 2.0 based API to an IIS 10 server on Windows Server 2016 using WebDeploy in Visual Studio 2017. It wants to create/overwrite the Web.Config settings I have with whatever Core 2.0 thinks is correct

The issue is that it forces processPath="dotnet" into the file no matter what I do, but that always gives me a 502.5 error. If I add the full path for dotnet.exe everything works fine.

Fails: 
<aspNetCore processPath="dotnet" arguments=".\MyServer.Server.dll" stdoutLogEnabled="true" stdoutLogFile=".\logs\stdout" />

Works:  
<aspNetCore processPath="C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\dotnet.exe" arguments=".\MyServer.Server.dll" stdoutLogEnabled="true" stdoutLogFile=".\logs\stdout" />

I have checked all my system paths and permissions but nothing seems to be wrong. This is forcing me to manually edit the web.config file every time I publish because the generated file breaks my server.

Does anyone know what is going on or how to fix this? Alternately, does anyone know how to override ASP.NET core 2.0 generation of the web.config file, specifically the processPath value?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Route not matched for specific route variable value" (#2772) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
My ASP.NET Core 2 app is not matching a route for a specific variable in the path. I have been unable to reproduce this outside of the project it occurs in, or with any other values for the variable.

The route below is not matched when the tenant is "evt".
```
 routes.MapRoute(
    name: "tenant",
    template: "{tenant}/{controller}/{action}/{id?}");
```
Log entries for the failed and successful matches:
Request starting HTTP/1.1 GET http://localhost:44314/evt/projects/index  
The request path  does not match a supported file type
Request did not match any routes.

Request starting HTTP/1.1 GET http://localhost:44314/es/projects/index  
The request path /es/projects/index does not match a supported file type
Request successfully matched the route with name 'tenant' and template '{tenant}/{controller}/{action}/{id?}'.

Request starting HTTP/1.1 GET http://localhost:44314/wtfwtf/projects/index  
The request path /wtfwtf/projects/index does not match a supported file type
Request successfully matched the route with name 'tenant' and template '{tenant}/{controller}/{action}/{id?}'.

I set up an IRouter implementation that simply wraps routes.DefaultHandler and the RouteAsync method is not hit for the failing URL, it is for all others. The log message from the StaticFileMiddleware
The request path  does not match a supported file type 
for the failing request is missing the path, which I'm sure is a clue but I don't know how to troubleshoot further.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fresh Checkout Doesn't Build" (#1298) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
### Fresh Checkout Doesn't Build
A fresh checkout doesn't seem to build correctly from the command line, even when following the directions from the [Building From Source](https://github.com/aspnet/Home/wiki/Building-from-source) page.

### Functional impact
I am unable to build and contribute to the project, as well as build and run the sample projects.

### Minimal repro steps
1. Clone the repository.
1. Navigate to the repository folder in a terminal.
1. Run build.cmd.
1. Wait for the build process to exit.

### Expected result
I expected a successful build.

### Actual result
The build failed with several errors.

### Further technical details
I'm just getting started with this project, so I'm unfamiliar with what is expected from the build and I'm not yet attempting to build from Visual Studio. 

I've logged the build output and created [this gist](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/antoinne85/800af997d077ae3fa80e5f3ad422134d/raw/b183f27393ea951de00729a49b605bdb8666ac4a/build-output.log) (link to the raw content--because of its size, the pretty view truncates it).

Any input or advice you might have on how to get up-and-running would be greatly appreciated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Consider the following optimization to TryParseMessage" (#1129) at aspnet/SignalR
Closed issue "Preserve ReadableChannels AsyncEnumerator" (#843) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
`ReadableChannel` no longer has `GetAsyncEnumerator` which we used for streaming. The feature will be added back to `ReadableChannel` when `IAsyncEnumerable` is added to the language in C#8.

Until then we should copy the method that was removed and use it internally.

See: https://github.com/dotnet/corefxlab/pull/1743#discussion_r138115851

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Flaky Docker Redis tests" (#1160) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Expanding this somewhat: I now have consistent failures on my desktop at home due to the docker container not starting properly. We should add some better diagnostics to these tests to report issues if the container fails to start properly so we can track down why they are failing on some (read: my) machines.

When your Docker for Windows instance is configured either for "Windows Container" or "Linux Containers on Windows" (LCOW), the Redis tests fail to run. In the first case, because Redis is a linux container and in the second case because of some bug in LCOW (it's experimental) that causes it to fail.

We should detect those cases and skip running the tests. You can detect this by the following command:

With Windows Containers or LCOW on (what we don't want):

```
â€º docker system info -f "{{.OSType}}"
windows
```

With it off (what we want):

```
â€º docker system info -f "{{.OSType}}"
linux
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Clients don't receive message (after upgrading to 1.0.0-alpha2-final)" (#1154) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,

After upgrading SignalR to 1.0.0-alpha2-final, clients don't receive messages anymore while it's working the other way (a client can send a message to the server).

Here is the call to InvokeAsync from the Hub (server-side):
```
            await this.Clients.All.InvokeAsync("test");
            await this.Clients.All.InvokeAsync("testNumber", 99);
```

Here is how I set up handlers on the clients:
```
            this._connection.On("test", () => { ... });
            this._connection.On<object>("testNumber", _ => { ... });
            this._connection.On<int>("testNumber", _ => { ... });
```

The connection on the client is build with "the new way":
```
this._connection = 
                new HubConnectionBuilder()
                    .WithConsoleLogger(LogLevel.Trace)
                    .WithUrl(this.BaseUrl)
                    .WithJsonProtocol()
                    .WithTransport(TransportType.WebSockets)
                    .Build();
```
Using `WithJsonProtocol` and/or `WithTransport ` has no impact. It doesn't work either way.

What have changed since the old preview ?

BTW, there is no logs, crashes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Don't use FormatException for negotiate response errors" (#1203) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody: If the negotiate response from the server is invalid, the client throws `FormatException`. This is not an appropriate use of that exception, as it's supposed to be used when arguments that the caller provides are invalid. We should use either a custom exception type or something like `InvalidOperationException`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SignalR 1.0.0-preview1 verification areas" (#1297) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
## SignalR Preview1 Verification

- Connect to server/Disconnect
- Client calls server methods
  - Read a return value 
  - Serialization of arguments (try different argument types, primitives, complex types, ...)
- Server broadcast to multiple clients 
  - Serialization ("ditto")
- Groups
  - Add to/Remove from group
  - Send to group 
  - Others in group
- Users
  - Authentication
  - Send to user
- Clients
  - TS/JS client
  - C# client
- Connection lifetime
  - Disconnects (with all the supported transports)
    - Graceful disconnect
    - Network interruption
- Transports
  - WebSockets
  - Serverside events
  - Longpolling
- Protocols
  - Json
  - MsgPack
- Binary
  - use MsgPack for binary serilazation 
-  Scaleout
  - Redis
- Streaming
- Bare websockets

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support absolute routes on Razor Pages" (#6605) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
## rynowak edit

In 2.1 we're going to allow routes specified in a page to use absolute route template syntax. That looks like:
```
@page "~/Example"
```
or 
```
@page "/Another/Example"
```

The key part is the `~/` or `/`. This makes the route template an absolute template, meaning that it **will not** be concatenated with the pages path. 

Example: (in `/Pages/Blog/About`)
```
@page "AboutMe"
```
This page will execute when the URL path is `/Blog/About/AboutMe`. In 2.0 the `/Blog/About` part of the route template is implied and cannot be overridden. 

In 2.1 we're adding this capability using the familiar syntax used elsewhere in MVC
Example: (in `/Pages/Blog/About`)
```
@page "/AboutMe"
```
OR 
```
@page "~/AboutMe"
```

This page will execute when the URL path is `/AboutMe`. What you see is what you get. This example provides an totally different route template that **replaces the default**. This was not supported in 2.0

---------

We decided to do something different than what was original posted in this issue for technical/design reasons. What was originally explained here would require us to compile **all** pages at startup time before MVC could respond to any requests. 

The approach used for routing in pages is specifically designed to work based on a simple parse of the document, without the need to compile and run the code. This allows us to quickly build a route table for a large number of pages. 

We're improving the capabilities that Razor has to participate in the build in 2.1, and doing a lot to make it fast too. We're very hopeful that what we're doing with this is going to be a good change for Razor and that most of our developer base will love it. If that's the case, then we'd have the ability to do some of the things detailed in the original issue.

------
## Original:

**Support attribute routes on Razor Pages and Page Models**

Based on feedback, we want to support customizing Razor Pages routes using attribute routing. This will require we discover and compile all pages ahead of building the route table

## On Pages
Would rely on #6562 to allow attributes to be specified in the Razor Page file. E.g.:

``` html
@page
@attribute Route("custom")

@* GET /custom *@
Hello, World!
```

## On Page Models
The attributes could be placed on the `PageModel` class directly, and/or on the handler methods, with very similar behavior to attribute routing on controllers and actions (cascading, overriding, composition, etc.). The routes would be additive to the implied routes (we can debate that). E.g.:

``` c#
[Route("custom")]
public class MyPageModel : PageModel
{
    // GET /custom/handler/foo
    [HttpGet("handler/{param}")]
    public IActionResult CustomHandlerMethod(string param)
    {
        ...
    }
}
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Refactor PageRouteModel generation" (#7240) at aspnet/Mvc
Closed issue "Html.DisplayFor does not find the template with @inherits declaration" (#7113) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
When display template contains `@inherits` clause in related `_ViewImports.cshtml` file, method `@Html.DisplayFor(...)` cannot find the template.

As soon as `@inherits` clause is removed, display template is found and rendered.

I did not test further, but I would assume that `@Html.DisplayForModel`, `@Html.EditorFor` and `@Html.EditorForModel` behave in a similar manner.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MVC razor Form with AntiForgery Token throwing 400 bad request on post to controller" (#7110) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
Weird situation where controller was throwing 400 bad request. I used Fiddler replay to isolate it to the forgery token. For some reason the token was occasionally being truncated or weird character on initial page load after login page, and so would fail validation on controller. 

Razor ex:

```
@using (Html.BeginForm("ChangeAliasProfile", "Profile", FormMethod.Post, new { name = "ChangeAliasProfile", id = "ChangeAliasProfile" }))
        {
            @Html.AntiForgeryToken()
            <input type="hidden" name="ChangeAliasProfileId" id="ChangeAliasProfileId" />
        }
```

Looks like a special line character is being generated in token - notice space after - in token

```
input name="antiToken" type="hidden" value="AAA...FFFWu904pKoe6W3jCfFECdFnr8zLQtH7UPv6CAdWH7dnvpRFIX_e2xvY8LEqokwz3LS61k2mJT33-0UUUH6gZgoQVLT_ZBjxkx_UkHXoeODjEJpWHBHZTXUn2UoafGddKc0UvemJLZaRnzGTBhkqFW4v5BkDFZez91a5qWZMHVpHXdOwBSwsKOEwEwOpt_mg" 
```

If i refresh page then same code generates a good forgery token without space

```
type="hidden" value="AAA...FFFWu904pKoe6W3jCfFEDtdBxjqDFtZ4Yeu8IUOMbbcqYjC3u8nh_JNFEv582wqyjVnkjDR5-_hAt_vDWKkQ_xRFVldGKNQqGS9CrwGfoivrn9NNGyU6yvOJTmJ5FFPKLB3m3d1WuzDDiQ-WI3q5LWUHDBLHji4hT3jHhXYYsn4IMdIQzjs92lE0iifcpDGw"
```

I changed it to use asp- helpers

```
<form asp-controller="Profile"
                  asp-action="ChangeAliasProfile"
                  name = "ChangeAliasProfile" id = "ChangeAliasProfile"
                  method="post" asp-antiforgery="true">
                <input type="hidden" name="ChangeAliasProfileId" id="ChangeAliasProfileId" 
        </form>

input name="gman" type="hidden" value="CfDJ8NJLo2wSzL5EpqEbMbEtWmjMLY5w1rcSJvv3mYrBAXimD2oxLauBNANK1Du2ZqG7PhuZJJmJOG03gkZXnT8KvVxARFNPPH_JyMJ112pgD9nKenV2rDKfAWMp_O4PB_KBhrJySitWv4ye1L0A3WqtXEbQNwz5Ok6NDdyVfmx8R9BvD-lvra5DuiZg7wwRZtOtFA" 
```

still throws 400 bad request. As soon as I refresh page, works.

I have modified the antiforgery service to use different cookiename / form field name

```c#
services.AddAntiforgery(antiforgeryOptions =>
            {
                // Angular's default header name for sending the XSRF token.
                antiforgeryOptions.HeaderName = "X-RequestVerificationToken"; //X-XSRF-TOKEN
                // Rename the Anti-Forgery cookie from "__RequestVerificationToken" to
                antiforgeryOptions.CookieName = "gman";
                // Rename the form input name from "__RequestVerificationToken" to
                antiforgeryOptions.FormFieldName = "gman";
}
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Razor Page Testing with IUrlHelper" (#7106) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
Could be something dumb I'm doing or something I'm missing, but wasn't sure if it was related to some of the Testing improvements on Razor Pages like on #6943.

I'm trying to create an absolute URL in my Razor Page page handler and pass that upstream to my "backend" (handler using MediatR, not that it really matters) so my backend doesn't know it's talking to ASP.NET Core or not.  It just needs a URL that ultimately gets e-mailed out to the user.

When I try to use `UrlHelper.Page("PageName")` I get a Null Ref Exception on something inside the stack at `(IUrlHelper urlHelper, String pageName, String pageHandler, Object values, String protocol, String host, String fragment)` that I can't see without debugging through.  Something in `UrlHelperExtensions` is dying before it delegates to `RouteUrl`.

And yes, my UrlHelper isn't null, I'm passing in a [Fake one](https://gist.github.com/scottsauber/fe204c7f83c43436a826d4884de10e27).  I've tried other approaches to no avail.  Pretty close to just wrapping IUrlHelper behind something else, but I'd rather not do that if I can help it.

Any pointers on how not to cause a null ref here?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Split showing and generating recovery codes" (#1567) at aspnet/Identity
Merged pull request "Use AuthenticatorUrl generated on the server in EnableAuthenticator" (#1566) at aspnet/Identity
Opened issue "Expose ASP.NET Identity via LDAP interface (.NET Core 2.0)" (#1568) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
I have an ASP.NET Core 2.0 application where I am using the stock implementation of ASP.NET Identity to manage and authenticate my users.

I would like to use my application as an identity provider for 3rd party service that I am planning on using. The only issue is that this service can only communicate with identity providers over LDAP.

Is there a way to stand up an LDAP server as part of my ASP.NET Core application?

I know there is an option to do so in Java by using UnboundID LDAP SDK. However, I cannot find a .NET alternative to this.

How should I go about exposing my ASP.NET Identity users via LDAP?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Split showing and generating recovery codes" (#1567) at aspnet/Identity
Opened pull request "Use AuthenticatorUrl generated on the server in EnableAuthenticator" (#1566) at aspnet/Identity
Opened issue "Improve test ability of TOTP" (#1565) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
IMHO TOTP needs to use ISystemClock to allow for testing to skew clock outside TOTP TimeStep, also at present the TimeStep is fixed at 3 mins which result in a window of 9 mins either side of the time the code was issued, this should be configurable with a note that a larger worn is less secure and a smaller windows is more prone to expire.

ie. when using an authenticator application a small windows of 2 mins is suffice
     while using email/phone TOTP systems a larger window is required due to delays in communication of the code to the user

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Load the developer certificate from a default path provided a configuration key has been specified for it" (#2246) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
Makes kestrel search for a certificate on a default path based on the presence of a password in config for the default certificate and no explicit path configured for it.

This pattern supports containers scenarios where the path changes between the app being run in a container vs the app being run on the host.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TaskCanceledException while reading HttpRequest body content" (#2256) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
We see task cancellations while trying to copy the request body content. We do not specify a token to be monitored anywhere in the Request pipeline. The code to read the request content is,

`await _httpContext.Request.Body.CopyToAsync(_contentStream);`

The error we see,

`System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException: A task was canceled.
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at OSIsoft.Data.Server.Http.HttpMessage.<TryUnpack>d__21.MoveNext()`

TryUnpack has the code to copy content from the request body. This is not reproducible on our machines, but we see that happen frequently on our test servers.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Kestrel Not Opening Port on Ubuntu" (#2255) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
Dear All, 
I have an application which is running fine on one machine using ubuntu 16 and I am trying to deploy the same application on the other freshly installed machine. When i run the application it shows me successful message 

exilliumwebserver@ExilliumWebServer:~/exiadmin$ dotnet Admin.dll
Hosting environment: Production
Content root path: /home/exilliumwebserver/exiadmin
Now listening on: http://localhost:5001
Application started. Press Ctrl+C to shut down.

But nor the 5001 port opens neither the web runs. I have tried checking it my using nmap. All the other machines on which I am running kestrel web server doesnt show any of such error. Please enlighten !

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Unify how AdhocWorkspace is constructed." (#1926) at aspnet/Razor

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Identity: Consider less generic name for ManageController" (#86) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
Manage is a very generic name and you would probably expect http://abcdefg/Manage to be about managing something from your applications business domain rather than user accounts.

ManageAccount would probably be a better name.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need more templates" (#115) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
MVC 6 project templates should include a test project template. And the main ASP.NET 5 Preview Templates / Web Application or ... / Empty templates should have a few more sub-options, enabling for example addition and removal of XML support, creation of a minimal MVC project, or adding in EF (without choosing Individual User Accounts authentication).

Hopefully this will allow the new project dialogue to enable the options shown below -- plus a few options specific to MVC 6.
![disabled project features](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6431421/8257821/2a76a606-1665-11e5-8e75-cdb21473f6a1.png)

Events.RelatedBody: Porting from MVC repo https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/2637

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a SPA template" (#137) at aspnet/Templates
Closed issue "Poor user and dev experience in Identity email confirmation" (#365) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
There are two issues using the default template for identity when using email confirmation.

Following the guide here: http://docs.asp.net/en/latest/security/authentication/accconfirm.html

Poor user experience: When you click "Register" it sends the email off, but just redirects the user to the Home controller. Redirecting to something else to indicate they have to confirm their account would be a better example. Perhaps the default template should have such a view OOTB.

Poor dev experience: When logging in with an external account (lets say Facebook) if the account doesn't exist you get thrown into AccountController.ExternalLoginConfirmation, great. This screen requires an email, so you complete the registration then you're logged in but never shoots off the email confirmation link here. Perhaps a commented out section in this action to deal with this would improve the dev experience here.

I'm not aware if that was on purpose or not, but we should be consistent with the empty projects. I think we should not add the Project_Readme.html for all Empty projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove project file elements added for WebApiCompatShim in 2.0" (#286) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim package now depends on the latest (5.2.4-preview1) Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package. That dependency includes a new .NET Standard 2.0 assembly. This assembly supports all platforms the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim package supports and includes the full Web API Client feature set.

When upgrading projects using the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim package to our nightly builds or the forthcoming 2.1.0-preview1 release, we recommend removing the following elements from the project file. (Of course, some projects may need the elements for other reasons.)
``` xml
<PackageTargetFallback>$(PackageTargetFallback);portable-net451+win8</PackageTargetFallback>
<DisableImplicitAssetTargetFallback>true</DisableImplicitAssetTargetFallback>
```

FYI the `<PackageTargetFallback>` element caused the application to build and run against the Portable Class Library (PCL) assembly from the Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package.

For discussion of this change, see aspnet/Mvc#7229.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Microsoft Security Advisory CVE-2018-0784 - ASP.NET Core Templates enable Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability" (#285) at aspnet/Announcements
Opened issue "Microsoft Security Advisory CVE-2018-0785 - ASP.NET Core Templates enable Cross Site Request Forgery" (#284) at aspnet/Announcements
Opened issue "Using the "Home" repo for issue management of other repos" (#283) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi all,

We are experimenting to try and use the [Home repo's issue tracker](https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues) to manage issues for multiple repos. To start with, we have moved the bugs from several other repos to the Home repo, and we will retire the issue trackers of those other repos.

We are doing this to try to improve the experience of logging issues for ASP.NET Core.

* Labels in the form of `repo:RepoName` are used to associate the bug with a product/feature area
* For issue trackers that moved to the Home repo, please log new issues in the Home repo. If a bug is logged in a moved issue tracker, it will be closed.
* Over time, we plan to consolidate more issue trackers into the Home repo

For discussions on this topic, please go to https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2736.

Thanks,
Eilon
